author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
Floating or sinking is due to density, but not just bone density. The density of the human body is an average of bones, muscles, fat, other soft tissue and, perhaps most importantly in this situation, air.  As you inhale and exhale the volume of air your lungs changes your overall density which influences if you float or sink.
Source Video: https://www.youtube.com/shorts/xymCC6pTt4w
 #diving #density #science #shorts

title: Why Does One Diver Float?
